[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 13]
Reasoning: **Evaluating purchase options**

I'm in the shop with just $2. I can't afford Mars, which costs $3. I think I could sell either Smiley or the Chariot to make the purchase possible. If I sell the Chariot, I’d have enough for Mars, but I'd lose a powerful item. Selling Smiley would give me $4, and I'd be able to buy Mars while keeping the Chariot. However, I realize keeping both items might be the best option. Let's proceed without selling anything.
**Deciding on round strategy**

I think it's best to select the round and then use the Chariot consumable when I have a target. However, I can't select a card from my hand right now since I’m in the shop. So, I'll need to move forward without using Chariot immediately and just proceed with the round selection. I’ll keep that strategy in mind for when the time is right.

[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 15]
Reasoning: **Considering card enhancements**

I’m thinking about using Chariot on a card in hand. If I do, the card becomes steel and stays in my hand, enhancing my selected card. This gives a nice x1.5 multiplier when I play other hands, particularly early in the game. However, spade cards are debuffed, and enhancing a spade might not be good since debuffed cards don't score chips and have disabled abilities. So, I’ll choose a non-spade, like 2♥ in position 4 for the steel effect.
**Evaluating hand strategy**

I’m considering a strong hand with three Aces in hearts, clubs, and diamonds, plus a king of diamonds and 10♥, 9♣. I could aim for three of a kind with the Aces by choosing positions 2, 5, and 7, but only the trips score, and with Smiley Face, I won't get a bonus since there’s no face card. So, the total would be 189 chips. The steel card I held (2♥) gives a nice x1.5 multiplier, making it 283 chips total, but that won't reach 600. A full house might be better, but I lack pairs besides the Aces, so sticking with three of a kind seems the best choice.
**Considering card strategy**

I’m weighing the option to discard for straights or a flush, but spades being debuffed impacts that. A flush in hearts might be possible, though. With a total of 600 chips needed across four hands, if each can score 200-300 chips, then playing trips Aces with the steel held should give me around 280 chips. My first action will be to use Chariot on the 2♥ in position 4. For the next step, I’ll go ahead and use the consumable on that card.

Command: use_consumable 1 4

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
